news.title: Bengaluru: BDA, forest department to hold joint survey to resolve Banashankari land dispute
news.para: A joint survey by BDA and the forest department is scheduled in two weeks to resolve a land dispute affecting hundreds of site owners in Banashankari 6th Stage. This follows conflicting claims over 16 acres, potentially impacting a 100-meter buffer zone around BM Kaval Agara forest land.

news.title: Compound wall collapse prompts evacuation from 192 apartments in Surat
news.para: Residents of 192 apartments at Shiv Residency were evacuated after a deep foundation pit's retaining wall collapsed, causing the compound wall to cave in. The Surat Municipal Corporation suspended licenses of four individuals for negligence, citing water accumulation and soil settlement as probable causes for the incident.

news.title: About 50,000 paperless property registrations done in Haryana: Financial commissioner
news.para: Haryana has successfully completed nearly 50,000 property registrations using its new paperless system, a significant shift in revenue practices. The state plans to introduce security-embedded paper and an auto-mutation facility to enhance transparency and efficiency. E-signed copies will be provided on the spot to applicants upon request.

news.title: Hubballi smart city houses remain vacant as families wait for keys
news.para: Smart City homes for families displaced by road expansion in Hubballi remain undelivered by the HDMC. Built in 2022, these houses are still unoccupied due to pending electrical and sanitation work. Beneficiaries, who were promised possession last September, continue to wait. The delay has led to the deterioration of the newly constructed buildings.

news.title: Police seek tenant data from apartments in Bengaluru
news.para: Kumbalgodu Police asked residents’ welfare associations asked to share details of out-of-state residents, foreign nationals and private staff

news.title: NGT orders attachment of Gaursons Promoters' office, criminal action against MD
news.para: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the Ghaziabad district magistrate to issue a warrant of attachment against Gaursons Promoters Private Limited's headquarters for failing to comply with a relocation order for a garbage collection center. The NGT also directed a criminal complaint against the developer's managing director for persistent disregard of its directives.

news.title: Supreme court restrains activity on 100 acres disputed land in Shamshabad
news.para: The Supreme Court has ordered private parties claiming 100 acres in Shamshabad and Paigah village to halt all construction and property transactions. This directive comes as the Telangana High Court investigates a potentially fabricated judicial order submitted by a claimant, Mohammad Taher Khan, who is appealing HMDA's ownership of the land.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh HC seeks government counter on Vizag IT park land allotment
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh High Court has directed the state government to detail land allotment procedures for Visakhapatnam's IT park, responding to a PIL challenging Raheja Corporation's 27.1-acre allocation. While declining a stay, the court sought information on the APLIfT policy and job creation conditions.

news.title: Court rejects ARC plea for auction of DSK properties
news.para: A special court has rejected Encore Asset Reconstruction Company's request to auction properties linked to the DSK group. The court cited that the properties are attached under both PMLA and MPID acts. This decision aims to protect thousands of investors who lost their savings. The court also noted the plea was premature as MPID attachment confirmation is pending.

news.title: Bengaluru development body to monetise land, eyes ₹1,800-crore boost from auctions
news.para: The Bengaluru Development Authority (BDA) plans to raise up to ₹1,800 crore by auctioning prime urban land parcels, including a 52-acre commercial site in Konadasapura along the Whitefield–Hosakote corridor. The e-auction runs from December 1–18, 2025, with 25% payment upfront and the remainder within 45 days.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Developers accused of cheating 95 buyers out of ₹35 crore
news.para: A housing project in Chharodi village has led to a cheating complaint against developers, with 95 buyers allegedly defrauded of Rs 35 crore. Buyers were promised flats without RERA registration or NA permission, only to discover the land was sold off. Developers admitted diverting funds to other projects and inability to refund buyers.

news.title: Gurugram: Property registrations blocked in Raheja Developers' commercial project
news.para: The district town planner has ordered the sub-registrar to halt property transactions for Raheja Developers' commercial project in Sector 84, Gurugram, as its development licence expired in May 2019 and was not renewed. The builder has also been directed to cease all site work immediately to protect buyers' interests.

news.title: ED raid at Models Group; members get anticipatory bail
news.para: A Merces court granted interim anticipatory bail to Natalina Vaz and her children in a land-grabbing case under ED probe. The defense argued the FIR was filed 15 years ago, the accused were not linked to the company then, and it's a civil dispute.

news.title: Former promoter sells 9% stake in AkzoNobel India for ₹1,296 crore
news.para: Imperial Chemical Industries has officially sold off a 9 percent share in AkzoNobel India, amounting to an impressive Rs 1,296 crore. In a strategic move, Goldman Sachs Asset Management picked up part of this stake, while JSW Paints has made headlines by securing a majority position in AkzoNobel India.

news.title: Chief vigilance officer orders action against illegal construction in Ludhiana’s BRS Nagar
news.para: A senior vigilance officer has ordered the Municipal Corporation to take action against illegal commercial construction in BRS Nagar. The building, located on a residential plot, is reportedly being built for commercial use, violating town planning rules. The construction of the second floor is ongoing. A complaint also alleges repeated tree cutting, a violation of state policy.

news.title: Mumbai: Parel residents flag ‘polluting’ SRA building site
news.para: A Parel residents' forum has complained to the MPCB about a Slum Rehabilitation Authority project violating pollution norms. Excavation and activities reportedly continue until 2 am, with a lack of dust control measures like sprinklers or tarpaulin. The MPCB will depute an officer to investigate the matter.

news.title: Accountability is missing in Goa government: HC on illegal constructions
news.para: The Bombay High Court has strongly criticized the Goa government for its lack of accountability regarding illegal constructions. Justices questioned why trade licenses were issued for structures with demolition orders and how commercial operations continued without occupancy certificates, emphasizing the need for preventative measures to ensure public safety.

news.title: CRZ maps & land records forgery: BMC not cooperating with probe, SIT tells HC
news.para: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) informed the Bombay High Court that the BMC is hindering the probe into alleged large-scale tampering of land records and fake city survey maps in Madh island. Despite previous court directives, the BMC's lack of cooperation persists, prompting the High Court to order BMC officials to appear before the SIT.

news.title: Mumbai: Few thousand Dharavi residents need to move to transit homes
news.para: Dharavi redevelopment project will require thousands of residents to move to transit or rental accommodation, contradicting earlier key-to-key rehab promises. This relocation is deemed necessary for the project's smooth transition and to expedite construction. Eviction notices have been issued, with eligible residents offered rent, while others are being moved to previously permanent housing now designated as transit tenements.

news.title: Gujarat govt tells civic bodies, urban development bodies to prepare draft development plans by June 30
news.para: Gujarat is accelerating urban development, aiming to finalize draft development plans and pending town planning schemes by June 30, 2025. This push follows the state's successful bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games and is also timed with upcoming local body elections in early 2026.
